info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 03 at 6:32PM EDT until May 03 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF HAMPTON AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 631 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Almeda Intersection to Robertville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 625 PM, quarter sized hail was reported at the North District Middle School in Varnville, SC. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: Hampton, Yemassee, Varnville, Estill, Furman, Scotia, Crocketville, Lena, Tarboro, Miley, Grays, Garnett, Pineland, Early Branch and Cummings. This warning includes I-95 in South Carolina between mile markers 35 and 41. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
